磒字的基本解释

磒
yǔn
古同“陨”，坠落：“化人移之，王若磒虚焉。”

磒字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yǔn］
［《廣韻》于敏切，上軫，云。］
坠落。

磒字的康熙字典解释

【午集下】【石字部】　磒； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页835第01
【唐韻】于敏切【集韻】【正韻】羽敏切，?音溳。同隕。【說文】落也。【春秋·僖十六年】磒石于宋五。　又【列子·周穆王篇】王若磒虛焉。【註】墜也。

磒字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
磒字的起名意思

暂无。

Basic explanation of words
Yin
yǔn
Gu Tong "fallen" and fell: "Transform people and move them, Wang Ruoyan Xuyan."
Yin
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［yǔn］
["Guangyun" Yu Minqie, Shang Zhen, Yun. ]
come down.

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Afternoon Collection] [Stone Character Department] 　磒; Kangxi Strokes: 15; Page Number: Page 835 No. 01
[Tang Yun] Yu Minqie [Ji Yun] [Zheng Yun] Yu Minqie,? Yin Jian. Same fall. [Said the text] Luo Ye. [Spring and Autumn·Xi Sixteen Years] Zeng Shi in Song Wu.　[Liezi·The King of Zhou Mu] Wang Ruoxuan Xuyan. [Note] Fall also.
